question: 1. Which of the following statements are correct about a 2-3 tree?

answers.a: A 2-3 tree has either 2 keys or 3 keys in every node
answers.b: A 2-3 has two types of nodes, namely 2-node and 3-node
answers.c: A node in a 2-3 tree can have only only one child
answers.d: A node in a 2-3 tree can have more than one root

question: 2. Key values in the nodes of a 2-3 tree always appear sorted from top to bottom and left to right in the tree.
3. Keys in a 2-3 tree are always sorted when __________.

answers.a: All leaves in a 2-3 tree are at the same level
answers.b: Atleast one leaf node in a 2-3 tree has two chidren
answers.c: Leaf nodes in a 2-3 tree are allowed to have more than two children
answers.d: Leaf nodes in a 2-3 tree may or may not have child nodes

question: 4. Which of the following is correct about a 2-node?

answers.a: A two node has only one child
answers.b: A two node has one data element and two children
answers.c: A two node has one data element and two children

question: 5. What is the time complexity of search in a 2-3 tree?
